basics.name: Tuan Do
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2028.

work.company: Game Development Club at University of Hawaii at Manoa
highlights: Developed core gameplay mechanics and interactive scenes in Unity 2D.
Contributed to the releases of 2 games.
Worked within a programming team of over 10 people and collaborated with art and music teams of around 15 students total.
Implemented 40+ art and audio assets across all games.

volunteer.summary: Aided a stall of 3 to sell various souvenirs and hats.
highlights: Managed high-volume customer interactions, providing service to around 20 to 25 customers at a time during peak rush hours.
Contributed an average profit of approximately $300 to $500 per appearance.
Involved in end-of-day breakdown and 'load-out' process, ensuring all inventory was secured and the stall area was spotless.
Monitored stock levels throughout the day and organized displays to attract foot traffic and maximize visibility.

volunteer.summary: Sold souvenirs and took down stall
highlights: Controlled customer flow, with maximum of 30 people during peak hours.
Averaged 7 hours of work and focus.
Handled friendly interactions with customers, providing a comfortable experience for all.
Manually took down stall by end of alotted time, with some assistance.

awards.title: CNS Achievement Scholarship
awards.awarder: College of Natural Sciences at University of Hawaii at Manoa
awards.summary: Won $2,500 each semester for School Year 2025-2026.

awards.title: Dean's List
awards.summary: Included for being in top students with highest GPAs for Fall 2024 semester.

awards.title: Seal of Biliteracy
awards.summary: Awarded for illustrating proficiency in English and Vietnamese.
